ID: 002: CAKE:
1) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Butter half sheet pan (18x13-inch) and line with parchment paper. Set aside.
2) In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with paddle attachment
column4: and vanilla until smooth and fluffy.

ID: 002: 3) In a separate bowl
With the mixer running on low
COOKIES & CREAM ICE CREAM DIRECTIONS: add flour mixture in three additions alternating with milk. Start and finish with flour mixture.

ID: 002: Scrape down bowl as needed to ensure thorough mixing. Fold in chopped Oreo cookies.
4) In a large clean bowl
COOKIES & CREAM ICE CREAM DIRECTIONS: whip egg whites using an electric hand mixer. Start at low speed until egg whites are foamy.

ID: 002: Increase speed and continue to whip to stiff peaks. Gently fold egg whites into cake batter in three additions.
Cake batter will loosen as you add the egg whites.
5) Transfer cake batter to prepared sheet pan. Spread into an even layer. Bake for 25-30 minutes
until toothpick inserted in center of cake comes out clean.
6) Allow cake to cool to room temperature in pan. Use a mini offset spatula or butter knife to loosen cake from pan.
Use a 9-inch parchment round as a guide to cut out one layer of cake. Fold parchment round in half and cut out two half rounds using remaining cake.
Immediately use cakes for assembly
COOKIES & CREAM ICE CREAM DIRECTIONS: or wrap in plastic wrap for later use.

ID: 002: ASSEMBLY:
1) Line 9-inch springform pan with plastic wrap
COOKIES & CREAM ICE CREAM DIRECTIONS: making sure to cover up the sides. If desired
column3: place a 9-inch cake board at the bottom of the pan.

ID: 002: 2) Place the two half round cake pieces at the bottom of the pan. Spread softened ice cream on top of cake.
Top with remaining cake round. Cover with plastic wrap and keep in the freezer overnight to set up.
3) Remove ice cream cake from pan. Top with whipped cream. Garnish with additional chopped Oreo cookies.
Allow ice cream cake to sit at room temperature for 5 minutes before slicing and serving.
